Description: Typical range for industrial laser cleaning of semiconductors like Silicon to balance efficiency and avoid thermal damage; starting at 50 W for light contamination. Max safe below ~200 W to prevent melting (Silicon melting point 1414°C). Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs for cleaning applications; academic review in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018).
Near-IR wavelength with good Silicon absorption for contaminant removal
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and process control
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant ablation with minimal thermal diffusion
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Number of cleaning passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
